00014 #ifndef ULIB_OPTIONS_H
00015 #define ULIB_OPTIONS_H 1
00016 
00017 #include <ulib/string.h>
00018 
00019 #ifndef ARGS
00020 #define ARGS "[ARGS]" 
00021 #endif
00022 
00023 #ifndef REPORT_BUGS
00024 #define REPORT_BUGS \
00025 "\nMaintained by Stefano Casazza <stefano.casazza@gmail.com>" \
00026 "\nReport bugs to <stefano.casazza@gmail.com>"
00027 #endif
00028 
00029 class U_EXPORT UOptions {
00030 public:
00031 
00032         typedef struct option_item {
00033                 UStringRep* desc;
00034                 UStringRep* value;
00035                 UStringRep* long_opt;
00036                 int has_arg;
00037                 char short_opt;
00038         } option_item;
00039 
00040         // Check for memory error
00041         U_MEMORY_TEST
00042 
00043         // Allocator e Deallocator
00044         U_MEMORY_ALLOCATOR
00045         U_MEMORY_DEALLOCATOR
00046 
00047         UString package,
00048                           version,
00049                           purpose,
00050                           args,
00051                           report_bugs;
00052 
00053         // COSTRUTTORI
00054 
00055         UOptions(uint32_t n)
00056                 {
00057                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UOptions, "%u", n)
00058 
00059                 length   = 0;
00060                 capacity = n;
00061 
00062                 item = U_MALLOC_N(n, option_item);
00063 
00064 #  ifdef PACKAGE
00065                 package = U_STRING_FROM_CONSTANT(PACKAGE);
00066 #  endif
00067 #  ifdef VERSION
00068                 version = U_STRING_FROM_CONSTANT(VERSION);
00069 #  endif
00070 #  ifdef PURPOSE
00071                 purpose = U_STRING_FROM_CONSTANT(PURPOSE);
00072 #  endif
00073 #  ifdef ARGS
00074                 args = U_STRING_FROM_CONSTANT(ARGS);
00075 #  endif
00076 #  ifdef REPORT_BUGS
00077                 report_bugs = U_STRING_FROM_CONSTANT(REPORT_BUGS);
00078 #  endif
00079                 }
00080 
00081         ~UOptions();
00082 
00083         // SERVICES
00084 
00085         void add(const UString& desc,
00086                                 const UString& long_opt,
00087                                 const UString& default_value,
00088                                 int has_arg = 1, char short_opt = '\0');
00089 
00090         // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00091         // [package <PACKNAME>]
00092         // [version <VERSION>]
00093         // [purpose <PURPOSE>]
00094         // [report_bugs <REPORT_BUGS>]
00095         // option <SHORT> <LONG> <HAS_ARG> <DESC> <DEFAULT>
00096         // option <SHORT> <LONG> <HAS_ARG> <DESC> <DEFAULT>
00097         // ....
00098         // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00099         // purpose "sample test for UOption class"
00100         // option a option_a               0 "A option without arg"       ""
00101         // option b option_b               1 "A option with arg"          ""
00102         // option c option_c               2 "A option with optional arg" Hello
00103         // option - option_with_no_short_1 0 "A option without short"     ""
00104         // option - option_with_no_short_2 1 "A option with default"      Hello
00105         // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00106         // Example: program -h|--help
00107         // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00108         // ulib: 0.1.0
00109         // Purpose: sample test for UOption class
00110         // Usage: lt-test_options [OPTIONS] [ARGS]...
00111         //    -h  --help                          Print help and exit
00112         //    -V  --version                       Print version and exit
00113         //    -a  --option_a                      A option without arg
00114         //    -b  --option_b=VALUE                A option with arg (default=pippo)
00115         //    -c  --option_c[=VALUE]              A option with optional arg (default=Hello)
00116         //        --option_with_no_short_1        A option without short
00117         //        --option_with_no_short_2=VALUE  A option with default (default=Bucaiolo a te)
00118         //
00119         // Maintained by Stefano Casazza <stefano@unirel.it>
00120         // Report bugs to <stefano@unirel.it>
00121         // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00122 
00123         void load(const UString& str);
00124 
00125         // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00126         // PARSING
00127         // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00128         // Scan elements of <argv> (whose length is <argc>) for option characters given in <optstring>.
00129         // If an element of <argv> starts with '-', and is not exactly "-" or "--", then it is an option element.
00130         // The characters of this element (aside from the initial '-') are option characters.
00131         // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00132 
00133         uint32_t getopt(int argc, char** argv, int* poptind); // return how many arguments
00134 
00135         // VALUE OF OPTION
00136 
00137         UString operator[](char c);
00138         UString operator[](uint32_t i);
00139         UString operator[](const UString& long_opt);
00140 
00141 #ifdef DEBUG
00142         const char* dump(bool reset) const; // dump the state of the object
00143 #endif
00144 
00145 protected:
00146         option_item* item;
00147         uint32_t length, capacity;
00148 
00149         static struct option long_options[128];
00150 
00151         void printHelp(vPF func);
00152 
00153 private:
00154         UOptions(const UOptions&)            {}
00155         UOptions& operator=(const UOptions&) { return *this; }
00156 
00157         friend class Application;
00158         friend class UApplication;
00159         friend class UXApplicazione;
00160 };
00161 
00162 #endif
